column1: Scramble: UR5+ DR3+ DL3+ UL2+ U5- R1+ D5+ L1+ ALL1- y2 U3- R2+ D3+ L4- ALL1+
Memorize 4 numbers using aforementioned arithmetics applying modulo 12.
<li>Memo 1: memorize M1 = D - R + ul - l. D - R = -1
<li>Memo 4: memorize M4 = d - r + UL - L. d - r = -2
Now we should execute 7 simultaneous moves (14 moves in total).

column2: white pin means the pin is sticking out
the execution never requires any operation on the two bottom dials.

column1: We will use left dial to represent the topleft dial
column2: and right dial to represent the topright dial.
then execute M1 with the left dial and M2 with the right dial.
then align D to R with left dial
then align C to R with left dial
column3: and align DR to R with right dial. Remember instantly C-U=3.

column1: Step 4: press down topleft pin and pop up bottomright pin
column4: and apply C-U with right dial (on the new face).

column1: You may forget all the memos now
column2: as they are used up already.
then align d to r with left dial (this will change dl)
column3: and ur to dl with right dial. These two steps are not simultaneous since dl will be changed by left dial.

column1: You may either practice to quickly compute the dl destination so you can do this simultaneously
column2: or see the 7sf improved version in next tab to learn the method to memorize this number.
then align c to r with left dial
column3: align dr to r with right dial.

column2: pop up bottom right pin (keep topleft pin up
column3: a backslash is now sticking out)
column4: then align ul to 12 o'clock (pointing down) with left dial
column5: align ur to 12 o'clock with right dial.
